channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: Why My 20-Year-Old iPod Shuffle Still Gets Regular Use
item.dc:creator: Rich Hein
item.description: Old iPod, new waves. My retro gear proves some tech really does last.
item.content:encoded: Two things that have been with me all my adult life are my passion for surfing and music. Surfing has been a part of my life since I was a teenager on the Jersey Shore. Back then, I would haul my board to the beach and sit while listening to mix tapes on my Walkman cassette player, while I analyzed the rhythm of the breaking waves, trying to find the perfect set.

item.title: 5 Retro Gadgets That Still "Just Work"
item.dc:creator: Tim Brookes
item.description: Don't throw these things away just yet.
item.content:encoded: Despite what most tech companies will tell you, not everything needs to be smart, designed around an AI assistant, or turned into an app. Sometimes, the old bits of tech you have lurking in your closet are still the best choice.

item.title: Tech Throwback Week 2025: Celebrate Classic Gadgets and Software With How-To Geek
item.dc:creator: Joe Keeley
item.description: Dive back in time as we explore iconic technology.
item.content:encoded: In your daily life, it might not feel like technology is advancing, but look back through the decades and you'll see much has changed. Devices that once dominated our homes and offices are no more, or at least look and function very differently.

item.title: Neewer NF01 Smart Corner Lamp Review: Smart Lighting With Decent Customization at a Decent Price
item.dc:creator: Timothy Jacob Hudson
item.category: NEEWER NF01 Smart Corner Floor Lamp
item.description: The light and color customization options on this smart corner lamp set it apart from similarly its priced competitors.
item.content:encoded: There are all sorts of smart lamps on the market. The Neewer NF01 is a relatively affordable option that outshines many of its similarly priced competitors with a greater range of custom light scenes and customization options, making it a great fit for any room, with just a little assembly required.

item.title: Why You Should Never Use Free Online PDF Converters
item.dc:creator: Gaurav Shukla
item.description: You are risking more than you realize every time you use them.
item.content:encoded: PDF is an incredibly popular file format for sharing documents, used by individuals and organizations alike. This means that every so often, we find ourselves in situations where we need access to a PDF converter or editor.

item.title: The Obsession with Vanishing Screen Bezels: Is It Just Hype?
item.dc:creator: Sydney Butler
item.description: From bulky CRTs to edge-to-edge displays, the evolution of screen bezels is a wild ride. But do we really need to eliminate them completely?
item.content:encoded: The "bezels" of a monitor or TV are the frame around the part of the screen that shows a visible image. Over the years the desire for thinner and thinner bezels has reached a sometimes unreasonable level, and the push to eliminate them altogether hasn't abated.

item.title: Recover Storage Space on Your Mac With These 2 Free Tools
item.dc:creator: Patrick Campanale
item.description: I didn't realize how much wasted storage I had on my Mac.
item.content:encoded: If you’re anything like me, then you’ve likely looked at your Mac’s storage reporting tool to see what’s taking up space on your computer, only to be thwarted by the mysterious System Data taking up insane amounts of storage.

item.title: 6 Nostalgic Computer Noises That Shaped Our Digital Childhood
item.dc:creator: Sydney Butler
item.description: From the screech of dial-up modems to the whirring of floppy disks, these iconic computer sounds take us on a journey back in time.
item.content:encoded: You may not have noticed if you're a little younger, but computers these days are just so quiet—not that I really have a complaint about that. Silent computers are better for concentration or to enjoy your media better, but not too long ago a typical home computer sounded like a mainframe from an old movie.

item.title: This Porsche Sports Car Will End Production in 2025
item.dc:creator: Tyler Dupont
item.description: A lightweight, driver-focused Porsche is set to exit in 2025, making way for an upcoming electric replacement.
item.content:encoded: A beloved sports car icon is set to leave showrooms in 2025, marking the end of an era for enthusiasts who cherish its balance of performance and analog driving thrills. Its departure signals a shift as the brand embraces electrification and a new generation of vehicles.

item.title: You Should Learn to Use Your PC Without a Mouse—Here’s Why
item.dc:creator: Sydney Butler
item.content:encoded: In the late 90s, our household computer mouse broke. Now, that might not sound like a big deal, but there was no such thing as a cheap mouse. No $5 Amazon special to tide us over. So I simply had to learn to use our computer with no mouse at all.
